u.a: Amy sitting in front of stove; Ann on floor , looking into suitcase . Amy leans over to watch . Amy gazes with excitement before she can even see .
it seems that she is simply making the correct response to ann's excitement .

as Ann throws stuff out of the suitcase , Amy crawls closer to pick it up . voices are soft and muffled .
Amy turns attention to snake on floor .
Ann picks up a pocketbook and offers Amy a "hat" . Ann pulling objects from suitcase .

still talking about her name , Amy flings the hat away and turns to the pocketbook she had picked up earlier . Amy takes the hat and examines it , but responds not to ann's action , but to her mispronunciation of "Amy" .
she has trouble unfastening it .
in the process of trying to unfasten the pocketbook , Amy bumps the oven door , which opens . she closes it with a bang and the noise draws ann's attention to the oven
Ann begins her concern with cooking .
Ann had been paying careful attention to Amy as she struggled with the pocketbook then Ann gets up , walks in front of Amy and sits in front of stove .
amy's response said with not even a glance in ann's direction , refers strictly to items she'd found in the pocketbook . <bef> Amy glances over to oven , intent as she is on the pocketbook .
Ann speaks with a chant , banging the oven door closed . an obvious attention+getter , and successful

Amy starts fooling with the oven knobs . for the next 4 line(s): the girls seem to be looking at the stove , not each other .
Ann takes over .
Amy turns her attention back to the pocketbook and glances around the floor for whatever it is she needs .
<1w-4w> whispered
for the next 1 line(s): Amy turns back to the purse and Ann returns to the stove . Amy turns to her immediately and responds . the whispering continues but gets softer .

for the next 4 line(s): whispered . Amy and Ann not looking at each other and are moving apart , but seem to be responding to one another .
Ann stares into the steering wheel . Amy stares at ann

from near the stove , watching amy
Amy gives this perfunctory response; she is involved with the purse and does not even look up . Ann is looking around for something to do .
Ann comes over and squats down next to amy
Ann responds .
Ann discovers some blocks on the floor and reaches over to get them .
Amy takes interest and asks for one .
for the next 1 line(s): Ann picks up some more and examines them while Amy watches her very closely .
Ann silently hands one to Amy who accepts it and attempts to put the blocks in the pocketbook . Ann leans over and watches closely .
Ann obeys Amy demand by reaching over and getting Amy another block
Ann verbally responds , and begins piling blocks up .
Amy quickly puts a stop to her participation with .

Amy is in charge again , directing Ann to pick out specific blocks . Ann goes over to get the blocks and then crawls back . there is little physical activity . both girls are focused on the pocketbook .
Ann sits watching while Amy is trying to fit the blocks in the pocketbook .
Ann suggests this but makes no effort to join her .
Ann speak with a burst of enthusiasm .
again Amy responds to the mispronunciation of her name .
for the next 4 line(s): in the ensuing conversation ann's idea of sentence 59 is forgotten and she sits watching Amy gather up blocks .
Ann takes a more active part in the block activity , at least verbally
said bossily
loud whisper indicating excitement . Amy moves .
Ann follows
Ann utters with a loud whispered excitement , using her hands to emphasize words . <bef> the girls are sitting facing each other .
for the next 2 line(s): Amy remains on the floor , speaking out loud as explanations of her activities . Ann goes and sits on the suitcase , as if expecting a certain chain of events to begin .
Ann corrects Amy .
Amy incorporates Ann the correction .
Ann sits on sofa watching amy's manipulations with boots .
for the next 1 line(s): whether Amy in fact believes that she will forget her boots if she puts them in the suitcase or because she is having difficulty putting them in there , she changes her mind .
with ann's suggestion , Amy decides to put her boots down on the shelf . she is still holding a pocketbook picked up earlier .

Amy begins moving the blocks and Ann moves to obey . Ann is still sitting on the couch , apparently waiting for whatever it is she proposed previously about pretending to be Hansel and Gretel to begin . she listens attentively . Amy faces Ann and speaks very clearly .
Ann agrees to the part assigned her .
<6w> Ann mumbles .
seems clear enough to be understood . Amy turns and responds .
reason for this is unclear .
Amy repeats herself with the same tone of voice and clarity in response .
Ann assents .
<aft> as soon as Ann is addressed as baby , she gets off the couch and begins crawling on the floor toward the back of the car . in repeating own previous question , Amy adds "baby" .
she seats herself on the floor , behind the car .
for the next 4 line(s): there is little physical activity as they discuss roles .
for the next 3 line(s): Amy twists around to face Ann , but otherwise they both seem to be looking out into space .
for the next 5 line(s): Amy is twisted around to face Ann they resolve their misunderstanding of just what constitutes the back seat by Ann agreeing to move from the floor to the rear of the car
Ann watches Amy turn wheel
Amy leads the way off the car , Ann crawls to the sofa corner near the windows , Amy follows .
seems to be a babylike whine .
for the next 3 line(s): the girls are sitting together on the floor with virtually no physical activity . Ann watches Amy silently .
<aft> in response Ann nods . Amy goes over to the oven . Ann sits in the same place . she grabs a pocketbook , dejectedly . Amy gets up on her knees and points to the oven
Amy turns to Ann she sees thet Ann has the pocketbook .
for the next 4 line(s): Ann pays no attention .
Amy comes over and grabs the purse from her , a fact which Ann accepts silently .
Ann just watches as Amy explores the purse with .
Ann moves to sofa .
Amy puts the purse in the suitcase . Ann on sofa watching as Amy takes purse out of suitcase .
Amy picks up her head to look directly at Ann .
<aft> in response , Ann points with her finger . Amy puts the "medicine" back in the pocketbook
suddenly Ann utters , gets off the sofa stands up in front of Amy .
utters .

Ann is standing , Amy is on the floor and the two are staring at each other . ignoring previous question Ann utters .
Amy says quietly . then Amy quickly returns to whatever it is she had found .

is not a response to previous but is clearly directed at Ann .
Ann seems to have sensed a way to get involved , for she begins bargaining .
the two are sitting facing each other .

Ann regains her interest by slightly exaggerated intonation . the topic goes back to the question about wanting to be a baby .
for the next 3 line(s): Ann stands staring at her back . again Amy objects , although Amy is looking into pocketbook and is turned away from Ann , her speech is clearly directed .
Ann disagrees .
Amy offers a compromise .
Ann reluctantly accepts .

Ann bursts in with a real game plan .

for the next 3 line(s): ann's intonation is exaggerated . amy's remains normal . for the next 2 line(s): Ann explains .

Amy goes over to the shelf and starts fooling with some paper , her mind not totally on the game . athough Ann has set up the rules , Amy takes over . Ann is sitting on the couch , humming and staring aimlessly .
Amy gets up and approaches Ann . seems the first of the series that is clearly directed .
Ann responds , lethargically .
Amy , facing her , answers . Ann sits quietly on the couch while Amy returns to the shelf and continues her monologue .
for the next 1 line(s): this seems to be directed at Ann , Amy glances her way .

content is clearly directed , though it was said quieter and with no direct gaze . this will finally Amy evokes a response .
response is spoken softly .
for the next 2 line(s): amy's questions become louder .
ann's response shows real interest rather than politeness .

Ann is looking around aimlessly at Amy , turns and faces Ann . she gets no answer and moves closer in to the car . she turns to the door as if hearing a noise . Ann walks over silently perhaps in response to the same noise ?
Amy takes Ann by the arm and starts pulling her .
Ann resists physically .
Amy is already opening the door .
Ann takes a very adult manner .
although Amy offers an explanation .
Ann has closed the door anyway .
Ann acts like an adult talking to a silly child .

Amy agrees and leaves the door , first looking around aimlessly , then going over to the holster she spots on the floor .
ann's attitude is similar to her previous remark .
Ann joins Amy on the floor and takes the holster . they are sitting very close , gaze directed at the tool belt but obviously speaking to each other .
said with a little more clarity than her previous statement .
Amy answers .
Ann takes the hammer and moves to the car .
Amy offers the pliers and takes the hammer . Ann accepts this . the quiet cooperation has ended and Amy gets up , follows her and utters louder than normal .
amy's taking the flashlight causes Ann to say this . "yeah" is said directly to Ann , the remainder said as she reaches behind Ann for the flashlight .
ann's objection is quiet .
Amy puts her tools in the pocketbook . Ann sighs .
is spoken into the purse .
Ann objects in a whining voice .
with some effort , Amy compromises and physically as well as verbally offers Ann the screwdriver .
Ann crawls over and takes it . she turns to the car and starts working .
Ann offers no help .
for the next 3 line(s): their talk is not directed . Amy is playing with the purse . Ann is busy with the car .

is said loudly and clearly , although its meaning is unclear .

Amy responds , with gaze directed to Ann .
for the next 1 line(s): Ann works with car . Amy looks through purse , talks with no direction .
mumbling
she stands and begins addressing the utterance to Ann , but in the middle she turns away and starts speaking to herself .
for the next 1 line(s): she turns back to Ann with hammer in hand .
Ann seems to be offering to use amy's hammer to do the fixing .
Amy , however , begins hammering on the steering wheel .
for the next 1 line(s): Ann rises on her knees and objects .
for the next 1 line(s): Amy stops and simply watches as Ann "fixes" the wheel .
